content: **thank you for all the love you have shown the 6-day kid blanket i hope your blankets keep you and your loved ones warm for years and years ** at long last video tutorials are here 1 and i even flipped them for lefties here 2 graphs for those who have asked for them are here 3 join the facebook group 4 for people making the 6-day kid blanket i m available to help answer questions on my facebook page 5 or by email bettymcknit@gmail com **pattern updated on 12-31-2018** ======= this update addresses some common issues that crocheters have had understanding the pattern if you think there is a mistake in the pattern or if you see corrections posted anywhere please contact me bettymcknit @ gmail com posting corrections without my authorization is a copyright infringement if you would like to help translate this pattern into another language please contact me bettymcknit @ gmail com i ve been inundated with requests for video tutorials they re here 6 multiples are given on the pattern for you to make adjustments for gauge or to make a larger afghan ** but i made a video to show you how calculate your starting chain for any yarn or size of blanket 7 ** if you need more help feel free to email me at bettymcknit @ gmail com or join us on my facebook page 8 or in the 6dkb group 9 some folks are getting hung up on the d3ctog stitch 10 it is a cluster worked only into one stitch not a decrease over three stitches ## dear betty i think your ravelry link is broken this isn t the right pattern ## the humble 6-day kid blanket has been crocheted by hundreds if not thousands of people and no two of those afghans are alike if you see this pattern on pinterest 11 or elsewhere thank you all for posting and linking everywhere made in different colors know that those crocheters took this pattern and changed the yarn and used the formula given in the pattern to adjust the number of foundation chain stitches to create a blanket that looks much different than the one shown on the pattern but yes it is the same pattern some of the crocheters who made ghans off of this pattern didn t change colors on row 5 and 7 like i did here is an article 12 to help you decide how to change colors if you would like a different effect i m sorry i don t know who made the lion applique either but you can find one by googling crochet lion applique at long last and after many requests i present the 6-day star blanket variation 13 you may find the 6-day kid blanket cheat sheet 14 and coloring pages 15 helpful add-ons to this pattern you can also make a 6-day kid blanket hat 16 a 6-day kid blanket scarf 17 a 6-day kid blanket shrug 18 a
